Text: Thanks for today, Natsume!

Thank you! I really appreciate you taking the time
to meet.

Not at all! Get in touch any time if you want to talk,
and not just about a new novel.

Lately, I've been able to start some very edgy
projects based around you!
I'm glad to hear that!

Well, you know, we're not public media, so we have to
watch the numbers!
Oh, now, what to drink... Huh?
What is this "coffee" thing?

The menu says it's something the Mitsugoshi Cafe is
experimenting with.

They say it has an energizing and relaxing effect...
But if you drink too much, it can irritate your
stomach.

Well, I'm keen to try new things! It'll be a good
conversation starter too.
Then I'll have a coffee as well!
What was it you wanted to talk to me about, Natsume?
May I be frank?
Of course!
Do you know of the Templars?
Oh!
I was thinking I could use them in my writing.
Where did you hear that name?

I found it handwritten on a scrap in some very old
Church documents I was using for sources.
It crumbled to dust the instant I touched it, though.
That word is all I remember seeing.
(Please buy it...)
An ancient note!

It made me curious, so I started looking at all kinds
of sources, but I've found nothing.

And I thought, with you being a reporter and all,
you might know something...
Hm. Well, "know" might be too strong a word...
But let's say I might have heard something.
Spoken like a true reporter...

I honestly wouldn't recommend digging too deep...
Exactly how do you plan to use this information?
I really couldn't say without knowing what it is.

I could give you all the usual reasons. You know,
for further study, for a sense of reality, but...

Without knowing what information you have or what
sparks it will strike, I can't tell what will come of it.
Hmmm...

I think you're aware of certain ruins the Church holds
in the middle of the City States?

The City States... The archipelagic states off the
northwestern edge of Midgar, located in the straits
between it and the Vegalta Empire.

I understand that warrior monks of the Church used to
practice a secret martial art in the Jugang ruins there.

They're very old stone ruins and currently managed
by the state of Orum as a tourist attraction.
It's a tourist site?!
Yes, the City States are famous resort spots.
Oh! That's it!
Have you remembered something?
It's more like I thought of a good project idea.

Natsume, you could go on a trip to see the ruins using
our budget and our connections and check them out
yourself. And MNA could get a great article!

I see, that would work out for both of us.
I'd love to help. Tell me more!
Well, it's like this―
Bleecchh!
Ahaha...I guess this coffee is kind of bitter...
But this bitterness and aroma... I think I'm hooked!
